page.title: 17THE VET(CONT)
page.content: Mr Barnes sometimes gets some very strange animals in his surgery: e.g.snakes, iguanas and{some very {strange circus animals.When the circus {comes to Dewsbury. The smallest animals that Mr Barnes treats are mice,wrens and fish.For fish you put medicine in there tank water.The wrens are just one type of injured wild bird brought in by school-children. He does not charge a fee for treatment of these. The longest jobs are ceasareans on cows and stitching up horses,there is a high number of people owning horses in this area.Perhaps these present the greatest danger some vets have died after accidently injecting themselves with a horse anaesthetic. If Mr Barnes cannot treat any of the animals himself he may send them to teaching hospitals in Liverpool and Cambridge.
